definition[0]: from the beginning to the end of a period of time
example[0]: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.
example[1]: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.
example[2]: Foxes remain hidden during the day.
definition[1]: at some point in a period of time
example[3]: My father was killed during the war.
example[4]: I mentioned the subject during our discussions at her Washington office.
definition[2]: at one point in a period of time, or through the whole of a period of time
example[5]: Did you hear the storm during the night?
example[6]: During the summer we spend a lot more time out of doors.
definition[3]: during all of a period of time
example[7]: The cafe’s closed all through the winter and opens again in April.
example[8]: Throughout her career she has worked hard and achieved the highest standards.
definition[4]: at one point or at various different points during a period of time
example[9]: I’m going to redecorate my bedroom over the holidays.
example[10]: She’s been a great help to me over the past year.
definition[5]: during a particular process or period of time
example[11]: In the course of the study we consulted with leading experts in global warming.
example[12]: Many factors control the rise and fall of a species in the course of evolution.
example[13]: There was huge social change in the course of the 1960s.
definition[6]: during a period of time, or before the end of a period – used when you want to emphasize that it is a short or limited period
example[14]: There have been five serious accidents within the last few days.
example[15]: Payment must be made within 30 days.
example[16]: If we are inviting you for an interview, you will receive a letter within 14 days.
